DataElement.preferredName: Decision Quality Instruments - Breast Surgery 2.3 Which Treatment More Likely Needs Another Operation to Remove Tumor Cells Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation about after which treatment it is more likely that women will need to have another operation to remove more tumor cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove abnormal tissue or cancer from the breast and a small amount of normal tissue around it. It is a type of breast-sparing surgery.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a discrete mass.
